title: Alexander Ek
text:
Bio
Alexander Ek is a Postdoctoral Research in the the Declarative Languages and Artificial Intelligence Section at KU Leuven. In 2022, He received his PhD degree in computer science from Monash University. Most of his research centres around combinatorial optimisation, data- and logic-driven decision-making under uncertainty, proof-logging, and trustworthy and explainable AI/software/elections.

title: Alexander Ek
text:
Alexander Ek, PhD
Postdoctoral Researcher
The Declarative Languages and Artificial Intelligence Section
Department of Computer Science
KU Leuven, Belgium

title: Alexander Ek
text:
Summary
My name is Alexander Ek and I am passionate about data- and logic-driven decision-making (under uncertainty) and trustworthy software. My current position mainly focuses on proof-logging and certifying model expansions in combinatorial optimisation. I am currently funded via the CertiFOX project and supervised by Bart Bogaerts.
My other projects includes combining data science and optimisation for election integrity (including statistical post-election audits), modeling and solving online optimisation problems, and multi-stakeholder optimisation with fairness considerations.
Research interests include:

Interdisciplinary research with real-world impact
Constraint-based optimisation modelling.
Combinatorial/discrete optimisation, and automated planning and scheduling.
Proof-logging, formal verification, and certifying algorithms.
Operations research/analytics, applied mathematics, and decision science.
Online/dynamic/real-time optimisation and robust/stochastic optimization.
Statistics, data science, and machine learning.
Constraint programming, and other solving technology.
Logistics, supply chain management, energy systems, vehicle routing, rostering, and scheduling.
Economics, fair division, fair resource allocation, and social choice theory.
Game theory, and bargaining theory
Election auditing, and election security
Mixed-integer-continous-discrete optimisation, including non-convex optimisation.

title: Alexander Ek
text:
Latest News


  
    New Position
    14 Jul 2025
  
  I started a Postdoctoral Research Fellow position in the Department of Computer Science at KU Leuven, Belgium, hosted by Bart Bogaerts in the Declarative Languages and Artificial Intelligence section. I will work mainly on proof-logging and certified first-order model expansion.
   
    Link: https://www.bartbogaerts.eu/projects/CertiFOX/
  

  
    Papers Accepted
    02 Mar 2025
  
  Our papers titled "Doing More With Less: Mismatch-Based Risk-Limiting Audits" and "3+ Seat Risk-Limiting Audits for Single Transferable Vote Elections" were accepted for publication and to be presented at 10th Workshop on Advances in Secure Electronic Voting (Voting'25) of the 29th Int'l Conf. on Financial Cryptography and Data Security. It will take place  14 – 18 April 2025 in Miyakojima, Japan
   
    Link: https://www.ifca.ai/fc25/voting/
  

  
    Conference: E-Vote-ID'24
    04 Oct 2024
  
  I presented a talk for our paper titled Improving the Computational Efficiency of Adaptive Audits of IRV Elections at the 9th Int'l Joint Conf. on Electronic Voting (E-Vote-ID'24), which took place 2 - 4 October 2024 in beautiful Tarragona, Spain.
   
    Link: https://e-vote-id.org/
  


No matching items

No matching items







  
    Conference: E-Vote-ID'24
    04 Oct 2024
  
  I presented a talk for our paper titled Improving the Computational Efficiency of Adaptive Audits of IRV Elections at the 9th Int'l Joint Conf. on Electronic Voting (E-Vote-ID'24), which took place 2 - 4 October 2024 in beautiful Tarragona, Spain.
   
    Link: https://e-vote-id.org/
  

  
    Talk
    22 Aug 2024
  
  I presented a talk titled "Post-Election Audits using Machine Learning and Combinatorial Optimisation" in Optimisation Seminar Series at Uppsala University, Sweden.
   
    Link: https://www2.it.uu.se/research/group/optimisation
  

  
    Talk
    16 Jul 2024
  
  I presented a talk to a public audience titled "Election Integrity: Using AI to Audit Election Outcomes" at the Melbourne Machine Learning and AI Meetup, Australia.
   
    Link: https://mlai.melbourne/
  

  
    Paper Accepted
    24 Jun 2024
  
  Our paper titled "Improving the Computational Efficiency of Adaptive Audits of IRV Elections" was accepted for publication and to be presented at the 9th Int'l Joint Conf. on Electronic Voting (E-Vote-ID'24). It will place 2 - 4 October 2024 in Tarragona, Spain.
   
    Link: https://e-vote-id.org/
  

  
    Conference: Voting'24
    08 Mar 2024
  
  I presented a talk for our paper titled "Efficient Weighting Schemes for Auditing Instant-Runoff Voting Elections" at the 9th Workshop on Advances in Secure Electronic Voting (Voting'24) of the 28th Int'l Conf. on Financial Cryptography and Data Security, which took place 8 March 2024 in the sunny caribbean city Willemstad, Curaçao.
   
    Link: https://www.ifca.ai/fc24/voting/
  

  
    Paper Accepted
    16 Jan 2024
  
  Our paper titled "Efficient Weighting Schemes for Auditing Instant-Runoff Voting Elections" was accepted for publication and to be presented at the 9th Workshop on Advances in Secure Electronic Voting (Voting'24) of the 28th Int'l Conf. on Financial Cryptography and Data Security. It will place 8 March 2024 in Willemstad, Curaçao.
   
    Link: https://www.ifca.ai/fc24/voting/
  


No matching items







  
    Conference: ASC'23
    15 Dec 2023
  
  I presented a talk of our recent work at ASC'23 (Australian Statistical Conference 2023), which took place 9 - 15 December 2023 in Wollongong, NSW, in conjunction with OZCOTS'23 (Australian Conference on Teaching Statistics 2023
   
    Link: https://statsoc.org.au/
  

  
    Conference: Best Paper Award at E-Vote-ID'23
    06 Oct 2023
  
  I presented a talk for our paper titled "Adaptively Weighted Audits of Instant-Runoff Voting Elections: AWAIRE" at the 8th Int'l Joint Conf. on Electronic Voting (E-Vote-ID'24), which took place 3 - 6 October 2023 in picturesque Luxembourg City, Luxembourg. We won the Best Paper Award in the Security, Usability, and Technical track.
   
    Link: https://e-vote-id.org/
  

  
    Paper Accepted
    24 Jun 2023
  
  Our paper titled "Adaptively Weighted Audits of Instant-Runoff Voting Elections: AWAIRE" was accepted for publication and to be presented at the 8th Int'l Joint Conf. on Electronic Voting (E-Vote-ID'23). It will place 3 - 6 October 2023 in Luxembourg City, Luxembourg.
   
    Link: https://e-vote-id.org/
  

  
    Graduation Ceremony
    18 May 2023
  
  I attended my PhD graduation ceremony at Monash University, receiving my degree certificate (testamur).
   
    Link: https://www.monash.edu/
  

  
    New Position
    07 Mar 2023
  
  I started a Research Fellow position in the Department of Econometrics and Business Statistics at Monash University, Australia. I moved together with my postdoc supervisor Damjan Vukcevic from the University of Melbourne. I will continue my focus on election integrity and auditing.
   
    Link: https://www.monash.edu/business/econometrics-and-business-statistics
  


No matching items







  
    It's Official!
    23 Nov 2022
  
  Monash University has conferred my doctoral degree and awarded me a PhD.
   
    Link: https://www.monash.edu/
  

  
    Conference: FLoC'22 and CP'22
    05 Aug 2022
  
  I presented a talk for our paper titled "Explaining Propagation for Gini and Spread with Variable Mean" at the 28th Int'l Conf. on Principles and Practice of Constraint Programming (CP'22), which took place 31 July - 5 August 2022 as part of the Federated Logic Conference 2022 in Haifa, Israel. For travel cost, I was awarded the Quality Conference Travel Fund Grant by Monash University and the Doctoral Program Travel Grant by the Association for Constraint Programming.
   
    Link: https://www.floc2022.org/
  

  
    New Position
    18 Jul 2022
  
  I started a Postdoctoral Research Fellow position in the School of Mathematics and Statistics at The University of Melbourne, Australia. My postdoc is hosted by Damjan Vukcevic. I will focus on election integrity and auditing.
   
    Link: https://ms.unimelb.edu.au/
  

  
    Paper Accepted
    29 Apr 2022
  
  Our paper titled "Explaining Propagation for Gini and Spread with Variable Mean" was accepted for publication and to be presented at the 28th Int'l Conf. on Principles and Practice of Constraint Programming (CP'22). It will take place 31 July - 5 August 2022 as part of the Federated Logic Conference 2022 in Haifa, Israel.
   
    Link: https://cp2022.a4cp.org/
